dead_formerclancat_J1: This isn't what I expected from the afterlife. Was this what you were hoping for?
dead_formerclancat_J2: I don't know why you can see me. It kind of freaks me out.
dead_formerclancat_J3: I don't think it's fair that I'm over here, and you're not.
Maybe there's some way I could sneak you in..?
No, no, I couldn't do that. If I do, they might kick me out...
dead_formerclancat_J4: Clans are cruel. This wouldn't be happening to you if you just left.
dead_formerclancat_J5: [You can't tell if being able to see {PRONOUN/t_c/object} as a ghost makes you more happy or sad.]
[{PRONOUN/t_c/poss/CAP} pelt is translucent, lacking any colour or feeling...]
[You miss the living t_c. So, so much.]
dead_formerclancat_J6: I'm sorry for your loss, y_c.
Being in a Clan is all about community, and helping each other out... isn't it?
You Clanmates will get you back on your paws. You'll be okay.
dead_formerclancat_J7: This existence is what I get for running away, I suppose.
dead_formerclancat_J8: You StarClan cats have a say in who gets sent to the Dark Forest, right?
So, why me? I'm sorry I ran away from my Clan. Was that what I did wrong?
Can I get you to forgive me?
dead_formerclancat_J9: Mm, good. Oh, me? Nothing, nothing, just endless fighting and starving and drowning.
dead_formerclancat_J11: How did you get over here? Is there an open spot at the border? Can you show me?
dead_formerclancat_J13: An outsider and a kit in the Dark Forest.
I think these 'StarClan' cats need to take a good look at who it really is they're sending to purgatory.
dead_formerclancat_J16: I guess leaving the Clans was the right choice, huh? You should've done the same.
dead_formerclancat_J17: I'm sorry you have to be here, little guy.
fcshunned_deaf_J1: [t_c looks at you very curiously, but makes no attempt to communicate.]
fcshunned_deaf_J2: [t_c is looking at you with pity.]
[You flash them a harsh glare. A ghost shouldn't be sympathising with a killer.]
fcshunned_deaf_J3: [t_c is looking at you with pity.]
[You flash them a harsh glare. A ghost shouldn't be sympathising with a killer.]
